data.title: Jonathan Rundman
data.meta_description: Astute folk/rock music for domestic, ecclesiastical, and automotive use.
data.text:
Thirty years ago my cousin Bruce Rundman and I started our own record company, and these Salt Lady Records t-shirts proliferated across the country. Now, in celebration of the label’s 30th anniversary, the shirts are available again for the first time in decades! High quality, super-soft shirts, available in S, L, XL, and XXL for $20 each plus shipping. PURCHASE AT BANDCAMP.

I’m very excited to be hitting the road with The Silos on their Midwest tour celebrating the 35th anniversary of the legendary album Cuba! I’ll be playing keyboards in the band, and opening the show in Chicago, Minneapolis, and Northfield. Also joining bandleader Walter Salas-Humara will be long-time Silos drummer Konrad Meissner (who also played on my album Public Library) of New York, guitarist Eric Kassel of Minneapolis, and bassist Ron Gomez of Nashville.

DATES:

WED, NOV 2: Milwaukee

THU, NOV 3: Chicago

FRI, NOV 4: Minneapolis

SAT, NOV 5: Northfield

On Sunday, August 14th, I’ll be ordained as a Lutheran pastor, and will begin serving at Shepherd of the Lake Lutheran Church in Prior Lake, MN.

Come over at Noon on that Sunday if you’d like to sing in the pick-up choir for the 2PM ordination!

In June I graduated with a Masters of Divinity degree from Luther Seminary in St. Paul, MN. Thanks everybody for the support and encouragement during all my reading, writing, and learning over these past four years.

Big news coming soon regarding the next phase of this vocational journey… stay tuned!

This past year it’s been a thrill for me to work with Walter Salas-Humara to record the new album by The Silos. I play keyboards and sing harmony on the album, co-wrote the song “Snow King,” and composed the string arrangement on the song “Love and Trust and Friends” featuring violins played by my children Paavo and Svea! The album, entitled Family, is out now and listenable on the streaming services.

From The Silos webpage

Apple Music

Spotify

New for 2022! I’ve updated the sheet music for my setting of A Heartland Liturgy, AND will be transcribing additional songs as well. For the first time, songs like “Calm The Storm” and “Row Out The Boat” are available as downloadable CHART PACKS including piano scores, lead sheets, guitar chords, lyric TXT files, and TIFF files of congregational melody lines for use in printed bulletins and projected slides. Visit my PAYHIP site for download links, and my Sheet Music and Copyright page for information on licensing.

ORDER the book at my BandCamp page.

$28 including shipping, USPS media mail in the US.

Orders include a download of the digital single “Paavo the Peasant,” a song from the book.

ORDER a five-book bundle at BandCamp, priced for value!

$106 including shipping, USPS media mail in the US.

Orders of the five-book bundle include a download of the five-song digital EP Vol. 1: Assembly featuring songs from the book.

Ten years in the making, this ethnomusicological memoir collects 28 songs from the Finnish-American Lutheran tradition. Notated and translated arrangements are included, along with historical and theological commentary.

I have unearthed obscure contributions from such luminaries as Elias Lönnrot (collector of the Kalevala), Finland’s national poet J. L. Runeberg, Jean Sibelius (composer of Finlandia), and Martin Luther. Some of these songs have not been heard or sung in North America for a century, and some have never before appeared in English.

ORDER the book at my BandCamp page.

$28 including shipping, USPS media mail in the US.

Orders include a download of the digital single “Paavo the Peasant,” a song from the book.

ORDER a five-book bundle at BandCamp, priced for value!

$106 including shipping, USPS media mail in the US.

Orders of the five-book bundle include a download of the five-song digital EP Vol. 1: Assembly featuring songs from the book.

TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 21, 7PM, FREE, ALL AGES

Lost Songs of the Suomi Synod

BOOK RELEASE concert and signing

Luther Seminary

2481 Como Ave, St. Paul, MN

Jonathan Rundman will perform with the Rundman Family Quartet and friends, LIVE on the steps of Bockman Hall at Luther Seminary. Outdoors, COVID-safe, and socially distanced. Bring a lawn chair or a blanket.

Celebrate with Jonathan the release of his first book, and experience Finnish music not heard in North America for a century!

This is a dream-come-true for me as a songwriter and composer: I have TWO songs included in the new Lutheran hymnal! Augsburg Fortress Publishers has released All Creation Sings, featuring my songs "For Such A Time As This" and "By Grace We Have Been Saved."

In celebration, I have released a new lyric video for "By Grace You Have Been Saved"... check it out on YouTube here:

June 28th will mark exactly 20 years since the debut of my double-album Sound Theology. I’ll be playing a special online Facebook Live concert on Sunday, June 28th, at 8PM Central Time.

Tune in, interact with me in the comment section, and help me celebrate this album that changed my life and career.

For the first time, I have created playlists introducing myself to the streaming music services.

Apple Music

Spotify

Check out my personal favorites from across my career, as well as my collaborations with other artists like Walter Salas-Humara, Beki Hemingway, Jeff Krebs, and Bruce Rundman.

This year, 2020, I’m thrilled to be celebrating twenty years since the release of my breakthrough album Sound Theology! To commemorate this momentous occasion, I’ve released a 20th Anniversary Highlights reissue of the album on BandCamp, Apple Music, Spotify, YouTube, Amazon, etc.

Search the socials for the hashtag #SoundTheology20 for the ongoing festivities!

My 2008 album Insomniaccomplishments is now appearing on the music streaming services for the first time, AND with three bonus tracks! Bonus tracks include acoustic demos of “If You Have A Question” and “New Eyes,” PLUS an alternate full-band studio version of “I Thought You Were Mine.”

Find it now on Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube, and wherever else you listen to music. And please support me by PURCHASING the hand-numbered limited-edition album on CD from my BandCamp page! Also, please add your favorite songs to playlists, and share on social media!

My 2015 album LOOK UP has gets an A-grade in the new power pop encyclopedia Shake Some Action 2.0.

It’s an honor to be included in this book with some of my favorite artists such as Parthenon Huxley, Jason Falkner, and Matthew Sweet!

May 2018 marks the 20th anniversary of The Muckrakers album release... a trio project I recorded with fellow Ishpeming natives David Casimir and Todd Berg back in 1998. To commemorate the anniversary, I have posted the original six instrumental tracks for our song "Prometheus" and I'm making them available to the public for remixing. Just visit my Soundcloud page, download the six WAV files, import them into your audio editing program at 163 bpm, and remix away! Then, when you're done, send me a WAV of your remix and I'll post it for free download at The Muckrakers Bandcamp page https://jonathanrundman.bandcamp.com/album/the-muckrakers and I'll promote you across social media!

Back in 2003 I released a new song "The Serious Kind." Since then the song has developed a life of its own, and I've continued to perform it at nearly every concert.

In celebration of the song's anniversary I'm making the sheet music available as a free downloadable PDF.

I encourage you to play the song yourself, with your band, or for your community!

ALSO: In commemoration of the song's debut, I'm putting my 2003 compilation album EXTRA CREDIT on sale for only $5, featuring the original studio recording of "The Serious Kind." Order the CD from my BandCamp page.

December 6th, 2017, is the 100th Anniversary of Finnish Independence. My song "Home Unknown," written from the perspective of a Finnish-American, will be sung at the Anniversary Commemoration ceremony in Upper Michigan. CLICK HERE for the sheet music and learn to play the song! Audio downloadable here from the RESERVOIR album.

Yes, exactly a quarter century ago I recorded and released my debut album 28 DAYS IN THE YELLOW ROOM. In celebration I'm providing the last few copies of the original CASSETTE TAPE pressing for $5, as well as the 2003 limited-edition CD reissue for $5. ORDER HERE at my BandCamp page.
